basics.name: Stephen Schor
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Competent user of popular web frameworks and adjacent technologies. If you look at the source and say "That's it?", then I'm happy.

work.summary: Creating and maintaining applications that help archivists describe digitized archival material and make material available to the public on the web.
highlights: Wirting maintainable and idiomatic Ruby, Java, & Javascript applications
Shepherded test coverage from 0 to +30% in 5 months.
Limited rights protected video assets by IP address using AWS Cloudfront.
Automated video transcoding for turning working copies into high, web quality video.

work.summary: Maintain and build web application and services capable of servicing thousands of requests per second.
highlights: Working in Node, Ruby, Golang to strike the best balance between maintainability and performance.
Sharing DevOps responsibilities with a team of fellow highly skilled, handsome developers.

education.area: MIS / Economics Major with Computer Science minor

skills.name: Web Development, Ruby, Node, API Design,

interests.name: Designing for testability, automation, squeezing the most out of 512 MB of RAM, distributed collaboration, intuitive design in code., Chaining apps with queuing.
